headline: Oportun Adds Additional Warehouse Capacity, Reduces Warehouse Financing Costs and Pays Down Additional Higher Cost Corporate Debt
summary: Adds a new $247 million warehouse facility with Citizens Financial Group, Inc. and Community Investment Management Extends the term of an existing warehouse facility with Goldman Sachs and Jefferies by 12 months Increases weighted average remaining term of combined warehouse facilities from 17 months to 25 months Proactively paid down $17.5 million of higher cost corporate debt in October, resulting in $50 million of total corporate debt paid down since October 2024 SAN CARLOS, Calif., Oct. 14,

headline: Does Citizens Financial Group Offer Value After Recent Share Price Dip in 2025?
summary: Thinking about whether to hang onto Citizens Financial Group stock, take profits, or make a fresh buy? You are definitely not alone. After all, the stock's recent performance has left many investors debating what comes next. Despite a choppy seven days, with shares slipping 6.9%, Citizens still finds itself well in the green over longer stretches. The stock is up 20.7% over the past year, and an impressive 134.5% from where it sat five years ago. These are not just numbers; they are signs...
